Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

We are Hiring!!Join Our Team at Veltris!!Position: Senior Data EngineerLocation: Hyderabad/ RemoteExperience: 8+ yearsNotice Period- Immediate Reach out to me, If you're passionate about data and eager to contribute to impactful projects. farhana.sultana@veltris.com  If you have hands-on experience with:Data Infrastructure & Architecture: Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL/ELT processes using AWS services  Leverage AWS services including S3, Redshift, EMR, Glue, Lambda, Kinesis, and RDS  Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like CloudFormation or Terraform Technical Skills: 8+ years of experience in data engineering or related field  Strong expertise in AWS data services and cloud architecture  Proficiency in Python and SQL for data processing and analysis  Experience with big data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, or similar frameworks  Knowledge of data modelling techniques and database design principles  Experience with version control systems (Git) and CI/CD pipelines Data Engineering Expertise: Proven experience building and maintaining large-scale data pipelines  Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and dimensional modeling  Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies  Knowledge of data governance and data quality frameworks  Familiarity with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) AI & Productivity Tools: Experience using AI tools to enhance development productivity hashtag#DataEngineer hashtag#Senior hashtag#Veltris hashtag#Immediate hashtag#TeamExpansion #TalantedEngineers#

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

System design for real-time AI applications: What you need to know!Real-time AI isn’t just about speed, it is about intelligence at the speed of thought.Here is a complete breakdown of the core components behind building responsive, reliable, and scalable real-time AI systems.1. Stream processingEnables real-time data computation using tools like Kafka, Flink, and Spark Streaming to power fraud detection and live updates.2. Real-time inferenceDelivers instant predictions using Triton, TensorFlow Serving, or ONNX Runtime - ideal for smart assistants or live recommendations.3. Event-driven systemsTriggers workflows on real-world events via Apache Pulsar, AWS EventBridge, or Kafka Streams - perfect for alerts and automation.4. Data queuesBuffers heavy incoming data loads using RabbitMQ, Kafka, or Amazon SQS, ensuring smooth traffic during spikes and high loads.5. Low-latency servingResponds within milliseconds using FastAPI, TensorRT, or NVIDIA Triton - crucial for gaming, finance, and high-speed apps.6. Monitoring & alertingTracks system health in real-time with Grafana, CloudWatch, or Datadog, helping you resolve issues before users ever notice.7. Auto-scalingAdapts to traffic with Kubernetes HPA, AWS Auto Scaling, or GCP Autoscaler to maintain performance during peak usage.8. Real-time feature engineeringGenerates live features from raw input using Feast, Tecton, or SageMaker Feature Store to power personalization and ranking.9. Model optimizationBoosts inference speed using TensorRT, OpenVINO, or Hugging Face Optimum - especially for mobile, edge, or latency-critical use.10. Edge computingRuns AI on devices like Jetson, Google Coral, or AWS Greengrass - enabling intelligence at the edge for IoT, drones, and wearables.💡 Save this if you are building next-gen AI systems.🔁 Need help transitioning to AI/ML or landing your next tech job with industry experts from MAANG companies like Google, Amazon, Microsoft & more? My DMs are open for mentorship.❇️ Free resources: I am compiling a job list of real opportunities for software engineers, not scraped from job boards but shared directly by hiring managers and internal recruiters in my strong network in the tech space. 📩 Want access?👉 Join our 1:1 mentorship program & I will add you to the Google Sheet!Everyone Who Codes (EWC) has a simple mission: helping engineers get hired! 💼Follow Lakshmi Marikumar for tech career & job search insights.Subscribe to our free newsletter on Substack: https://lnkd.in/gN83YA4Hhashtag#careeradvice hashtag#systemdesign hashtag#softwareengineering hashtag#techjobs hashtag#interviews hashtag#backend hashtag#softwareengineer hashtag#softwaredeveloper hashtag#MAANG hashtag#2ndtier hashtag#hiring hashtag#jobsearch hashtag#mentorship hashtag#ai hashtag#aitools hashtag#aiagents hashtag#dsa hashtag#behavioural hashtag#storytelling hashtag#mockinterview hashtag#machinelearning hashtag#aiengineer hashtag#jobs hashtag#apple hashtag#google

Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

System design for real-time AI applications: What you need to know!Real-time AI isn’t just about speed, it is about intelligence at the speed of thought.Here is a complete breakdown of the core components behind building responsive, reliable, and scalable real-time AI systems.1. Stream processingEnables real-time data computation using tools like Kafka, Flink, and Spark Streaming to power fraud detection and live updates.2. Real-time inferenceDelivers instant predictions using Triton, TensorFlow Serving, or ONNX Runtime - ideal for smart assistants or live recommendations.3. Event-driven systemsTriggers workflows on real-world events via Apache Pulsar, AWS EventBridge, or Kafka Streams - perfect for alerts and automation.4. Data queuesBuffers heavy incoming data loads using RabbitMQ, Kafka, or Amazon SQS, ensuring smooth traffic during spikes and high loads.5. Low-latency servingResponds within milliseconds using FastAPI, TensorRT, or NVIDIA Triton - crucial for gaming, finance, and high-speed apps.6. Monitoring & alertingTracks system health in real-time with Grafana, CloudWatch, or Datadog, helping you resolve issues before users ever notice.7. Auto-scalingAdapts to traffic with Kubernetes HPA, AWS Auto Scaling, or GCP Autoscaler to maintain performance during peak usage.8. Real-time feature engineeringGenerates live features from raw input using Feast, Tecton, or SageMaker Feature Store to power personalization and ranking.9. Model optimizationBoosts inference speed using TensorRT, OpenVINO, or Hugging Face Optimum - especially for mobile, edge, or latency-critical use.10. Edge computingRuns AI on devices like Jetson, Google Coral, or AWS Greengrass - enabling intelligence at the edge for IoT, drones, and wearables.💡 Save this if you are building next-gen AI systems.🔁 Need help transitioning to AI/ML or landing your next tech job with industry experts from MAANG companies like Google, Amazon, Microsoft & more? Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

System design for real-time AI applications: What you need to know!Real-time AI isn’t just about speed, it is about intelligence at the speed of thought.Here is a complete breakdown of the core components behind building responsive, reliable, and scalable real-time AI systems.1. Stream processingEnables real-time data computation using tools like Kafka, Flink, and Spark Streaming to power fraud detection and live updates.2. Real-time inferenceDelivers instant predictions using Triton, TensorFlow Serving, or ONNX Runtime - ideal for smart assistants or live recommendations.3. Event-driven systemsTriggers workflows on real-world events via Apache Pulsar, AWS EventBridge, or Kafka Streams - perfect for alerts and automation.4. Data queuesBuffers heavy incoming data loads using RabbitMQ, Kafka, or Amazon SQS, ensuring smooth traffic during spikes and high loads.5. Low-latency servingResponds within milliseconds using FastAPI, TensorRT, or NVIDIA Triton - crucial for gaming, finance, and high-speed apps.6. Monitoring & alertingTracks system health in real-time with Grafana, CloudWatch, or Datadog, helping you resolve issues before users ever notice.7. Auto-scalingAdapts to traffic with Kubernetes HPA, AWS Auto Scaling, or GCP Autoscaler to maintain performance during peak usage.8. Real-time feature engineeringGenerates live features from raw input using Feast, Tecton, or SageMaker Feature Store to power personalization and ranking.9. Model optimizationBoosts inference speed using TensorRT, OpenVINO, or Hugging Face Optimum - especially for mobile, edge, or latency-critical use.10. Edge computingRuns AI on devices like Jetson, Google Coral, or AWS Greengrass - enabling intelligence at the edge for IoT, drones, and wearables.💡 Save this if you are building next-gen AI systems.🔁 Need help transitioning to AI/ML or landing your next tech job with industry experts from MAANG companies like Google, Amazon, Microsoft & more? Really enjoyed Peter Deng's insights on Lenny's Podcast. His classification of the 5 archetypes of Product Managers, thoughts on hiring, and frameworks for building high-performing teams truly resonated with me.Peter’s 5 archetypes of Product Managers:·      Consumer PM: Product leader who is half designer, deeply focused on creating delightful user experiences. ·      Growth PM: Product leader who drives data-based decisions, thinks like a data scientist and is driven by metrics and experimentation.·      Buiness PM: Half business leader, half product leader, wired to think about business model, margin, value creation ... thinks like a GM. ·      Platform PM: Deeply wired to build tools for others, adept at building systems for others to scale their work. ·      Algorithms/Research PM: Equal parts researcher, engineer and PM ... leverages technical depth to build innovative products.A few points that resonated:·      The importance of hiring PMs with different superpowers to create teams that outperform individually brilliant contributors. ·      Tangible frameworks to align and raise the bar for team performance. For example, creating healthy tension with different charges for team members coupled with a framework to adjudicate.·      Practical advice for identifying and supporting each PM type for the needs of your organization.Highly recommend this episode for anyone passionate about building great product teams!https://lnkd.in/e5q5C5kihashtag#ProductManagement hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LennysPodcast

System design for real-time AI applications: What you need to know!Real-time AI isn’t just about speed, it is about intelligence at the speed of thought.Here is a complete breakdown of the core components behind building responsive, reliable, and scalable real-time AI systems.1. Stream processingEnables real-time data computation using tools like Kafka, Flink, and Spark Streaming to power fraud detection and live updates.2. Real-time inferenceDelivers instant predictions using Triton, TensorFlow Serving, or ONNX Runtime - ideal for smart assistants or live recommendations.3. Event-driven systemsTriggers workflows on real-world events via Apache Pulsar, AWS EventBridge, or Kafka Streams - perfect for alerts and automation.4. Data queuesBuffers heavy incoming data loads using RabbitMQ, Kafka, or Amazon SQS, ensuring smooth traffic during spikes and high loads.5. Low-latency servingResponds within milliseconds using FastAPI, TensorRT, or NVIDIA Triton - crucial for gaming, finance, and high-speed apps.6. Monitoring & alertingTracks system health in real-time with Grafana, CloudWatch, or Datadog, helping you resolve issues before users ever notice.7. Auto-scalingAdapts to traffic with Kubernetes HPA, AWS Auto Scaling, or GCP Autoscaler to maintain performance during peak usage.8. Real-time feature engineeringGenerates live features from raw input using Feast, Tecton, or SageMaker Feature Store to power personalization and ranking.9. Model optimizationBoosts inference speed using TensorRT, OpenVINO, or Hugging Face Optimum - especially for mobile, edge, or latency-critical use.10. Edge computingRuns AI on devices like Jetson, Google Coral, or AWS Greengrass - enabling intelligence at the edge for IoT, drones, and wearables.💡 Save this if you are building next-gen AI systems.🔁 Need help transitioning to AI/ML or landing your next tech job with industry experts from MAANG companies like Google, Amazon, Microsoft & more? My DMs are open for mentorship.❇️ Free resources: I am compiling a job list of real opportunities for software engineers, not scraped from job boards but shared directly by hiring managers and internal recruiters in my strong network in the tech space. 📩 Want access?👉 Join our 1:1 mentorship program & I will add you to the Google Sheet!Everyone Who Codes (EWC) has a simple mission: helping engineers get hired! 💼Follow Lakshmi Marikumar for tech career & job search insights.Subscribe to our free newsletter on Substack: https://lnkd.in/gN83YA4Hhashtag#careeradvice hashtag#systemdesign hashtag#softwareengineering hashtag#techjobs hashtag#interviews hashtag#backend hashtag#softwareengineer hashtag#softwaredeveloper hashtag#MAANG hashtag#2ndtier hashtag#hiring hashtag#jobsearch hashtag#mentorship hashtag#ai hashtag#aitools hashtag#aiagents hashtag#dsa hashtag#behavioural hashtag#storytelling hashtag#mockinterview hashtag#machinelearning hashtag#aiengineer hashtag#jobs hashtag#apple hashtag#google
